place.name: GLANDFORD
place.gazetteerText: GLANDFORD, a parish in Erpingham district, Norfolk; on the river Glaven, and near the coast, 3 miles NW of Holt, and 8 ESE of Wells r. station. Post town, Blakeney, under Thetford. Acres, 364. Real property, with Beyfield, £1, 663. Pop., 74. Houses, 17. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to the rectory of Blakeney, in the diocese of Norwich. The church was long in ruins, but was partly rebuilt in 1840; and it has a picturesque, ivy-clad tower. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
